body:
Reopen the issue if there is feedback on this issue.
Close it now.

Hi, @yhzl 
Has this problem been solved?
2.5.4 no, but 2.6.1 is OK, then 2.5.4 can use Dubbo configuration file to adjust.

Hi, pls use the latest version of dubbo, there are some problems with 2.5.x branch.
Seems solved. :)
Close this issue now.

Hi, there are sth wrong with doc.
Check = false in <dubbo:registry> means not throw an exception when the registration fails. 
Rather than throwing an exception when the registry doesn't exist
@carryxyh you can edit the list above directly.

@diecui1202 
Has fixed it. :)

Hi, this is in plan.
The rep is here:
https://github.com/zonghaishang/dubbo-rpc-http2

Hi, @caijunjun 
The new version of Dubbo is very good for async support, you can get more information here:
http://dubbo.apache.org/zh-cn/blog/dubbo-new-async.html

Not yet.
What is the scene used?

@eonezhang  http2 example: https://github.com/zonghaishang/dubbo-example-http2
I will provide more detailed documentation later.

@manzhizhen Pls. check the ci failure.

```
TokenStreamRecognitionException occurred while parsing file /home/travis/build/apache/incubator-dubbo/dubbo-common/src/main/java/org/apache/dubbo/common/Constants.java. Unexpected character 0x60 in identifier
```

Here I share the pressure measurement data:
program execution time：30min
provider logic：direct new object return
provider thread pool size：800
consumer timeout：1s
provider timeout：default
service agreement：dubbo

result:

consumer concurrent | tcp links | total invoke times | invoke fail（timeout）times | service invoke success rate | service invoke QPS | service invoke avg cost time | invoke time more than 100ms rate | （consumer cost time - provider cost time） avg time
500 | 3links | 49287931 | 1771 | 99.9964% | 27271 | 18.1ms | 0.006% | 0.31ms
500 | 2links | 47601583 | 1141 | 99.9976% | 26464 | 18.9ms | 0.006% | 0.38ms
500 | 2links | 47871439 | 1146 | 99.9976% | 26919 | 18.7ms | 0.006% | 0.41ms
500 | 1links | 46258320 | 1051 | 99.9977% | 25702 | 18.8ms | 0.007% | 8.99ms
500 | 1links | 46421769 | 1005 | 99.9978% | 25910 | 18.7ms | 0.007% | 9.84ms
200 | 3links | 55025248 | 478 | 99.9991% | 31066 | 6.4ms | 0.004% | 0.16ms
200 | 1links | 47376374 | 255 | 99.9995% | 26362 | 7.1ms | 0.003% | 4.89ms
100 | 2links | 55366764 | 0 | 100% | 30640 | 3.2ms | 0.0002% | 0.13ms

We can see that in the case of concurrent 500 calls, the throughput of two tcp connection transmissions is 3.5% higher than that of one tcp connection transmission, and the throughput of three tcp connection transmissions is increased by 6.5% compared with the transmission of one tcp connection. In terms of network time consumption (consumer processing time minus provider processing time), 1 tcp connection per call on the network takes an average of 9.84ms, and 2 tcp or 3 tcp connections are called each time in the network. The average time spent on it is only 0.41ms.

We can see that in the case of concurrent 300 calls, the throughput of three tcp connection transmissions is 16.1% higher than that of one tcp connection transmission! ! This is an amazing number.

@carryxyh pls. check the conflict.

Agree with back to 2.6.x
Ok, fix it soon.
Feel free to reopen if necessary.

@wangaicui just a demo, https://github.com/vangoleo/incubator-dubbo/tree/protobuf

Any one wants to improve this ?

Nice work!
The data for your press test is very great!
Regarding your pr, I think that directly modifying the default values ​​of connections can achieve the same effect. U can just have try.
:)
reopen if necessary.
No more feedback ? I'll close it. Reopen if necessary.
Anyone wants to take a look at this demo ?
@carryxyh Can Dubbo now set the default shared connection number to more than one?

> 本来想添加一下label但是不知道怎么加

Maybe u have no permission to label until becoming a committer. :)

IMO, dubbo-demo is good for users to dive deep into the code, also for us to verify features. So I suggest keep it.

Any Other thoughts?
@dz005 could u pls. add some unit tests for this scenario?

@ningyu1 @wj1369884616 I find there has 2 PRs, #2445 #2437 

could u two take more discussion about this issue, and merge them to one PR. thanks.

#2302 
has been merged to 2.6.x
travis log is here: https://api.travis-ci.org/v3/job/425526781/log.txt

@diecui1202 @wj1369884616 
My 'pr #2437' is a relatively small change in the old structure to ensure atomicity.
His 'pr #2445' is replacing the while with the semaphore, which I think is good.
I think using the semaphore is better than my repair.
What do you think?

hi, why most of commitor use mac or linux, windows is OK?
I have run 2.6.3 release UT on windows10 and lot of errors occurred!
always do not support bro!

@Vensence hi, does your service interface is end with * ? 
I have check the code, and find that when subscribe service interface is end with *，the expireExecutor will clean all registed service!
the problem has resolved. I replace dubbo to higher version(2.6.2),in this version,@Service has annotated with @Inherited,proxy could extends the @Service.

@playaround88 well...nope, it seems like the problem is from the network. Cause the service goes fine in my local machine, but not in the remote machine. What Really strange is when I deploy it in the machine(like10.100.112.15), everything is fine, but when I deploy it in 10.100.120.21 the problem comes out, and the monitor can't get the provider either
FYI:  the registry address is redis://10.100.112.26:6379

I reproduced the same problem locally. When use @Service(interfaceName = "xx.xx.xx") Annotation. ServiceConfig will mismatch the setter `setInterface()` .Given that the function `setInterface()` is heavily used through the dubbo framework, it is a good idea to redundancy a new function `setInterfaceName()`.

this pr should be merged soon.
It looks good to me.
I don't think there is a need to add a demo here. Only the simplest demo can be kept in the source code. Just keep unit tests and modifications. :)

maybe because the monitor.
just close the monitor and try again !
@ningyu1 @diecui1202 Using the semaphore, the thread will not block when the number of threads is less than  or equal to the maximum number of threads, so I think the performance is better.
I‘ve tried , well...problem still exists
@wj1369884616 Consent
Hi, would u pls send a pr to fix it
@playaround88 pls. issue all of the failed tests. Thanks.

LGTM
Thx for your pr.

LGTM,
Thx for your pr.
@playaround88 @diecui1202 I am wondering if the machine time isn't correct, would it cause the frequently register and unregister?

Hi, @yiwugou 
Would you like to submit an issue to dubbo-website? 
Of course, it is better to submit a pr together to fix it.
是的，到2.6.1之前就改成默认Zookeeper客户端是Curator了。你可以看下Github上各个Release的说明，那上面有，不在文档里

Group 不配置的话就为空

group必须一致才能相互调用，你说的对

mem | 128G
disk | HDD 4T
NIC bandwidth | 10000Mb/s

@kiansoung Thank you very much for your feedback. Please provide a github address to reproduce the problem, I think it may be a problem with the classloader
https://github.com/apache/incubator-dubbo/issues/2423 will be fix it, close it now.
This has been fixed in the new version, now temporarily closed, open anyway if there is a problem

* 组织：北京科蓝
* 地点：中国北京
* 联系方式：md@csii.com.cn
* 场景：新一代互联网银行分布式服务的自动注册与发现与RPC调用。
This pr is for the issue: https://github.com/apache/incubator-dubbo/issues/2471
PS: there is a grammar error in the issue template. "What is actually happen?" should have been: what is actually happen**ing**? or what actually happens?
sorry, have be solved!
@carryxyh Do there have other scenarios to use the async attribute on consumer side?  If no, we can ignore it on consumer side.

@diecui1202 
No. On the consumer side should completely ignore the Provider's async attribute, so that the Consumer's async and Provider's async are completely isolated, so I ignored it in ClusterUtil in my pr.
@carryxyh 如果在 Consumer 端移除该属性，则有一点要求是 provider 必须在 consumer 后面升级，否则会将标记透传过去，造成consumer 端变成异步调用。

Hi, @fingthinking 
At present, this is completely unnecessary. This property is added in the 2.7.0-SNAPSHOT version, and there is no release yet. After the release in the future, the user needs to perform an upgrade. We can just modify this bug in a better way, what do you think?
:)

@carryxyh I think we need to consider about the upgrading compatibility. Users need to upgrade the apps one by one, we can't ask them to do it with a particularly order. Even some times the Apps are both the consumer and provider.
Tomcat tries to stop all threads before shutdown. DubboSaveRegistryCache-thread-1 is a daemon thread, pls. ignore.

Hi, @diecui1202 
I checked the use of method.async in the 2.6.x version, and method.async was not affected by the Provider in the old version. Suppose we update and restart the provider first. Since the consumer uses the old version, method.async does not affect the use of the Consumer. So we don't need to worry about compatibility issues

@carryxyh @diecui1202 
[https://github.com/apache/incubator-dubbo/blob/2.6.3-release/dubbo-rpc/dubbo-rpc-dubbo/src/main/java/com/alibaba/dubbo/rpc/protocol/dubbo/DubboInvoker.java#L81](https://github.com/apache/incubator-dubbo/blob/2.6.3-release/dubbo-rpc/dubbo-rpc-dubbo/src/main/java/com/alibaba/dubbo/rpc/protocol/dubbo/DubboInvoker.java#L81)
在
[https://github.com/apache/incubator-dubbo/blob/2.6.3-release/dubbo-rpc/dubbo-rpc-api/src/main/java/com/alibaba/dubbo/rpc/support/RpcUtils.java#L148](https://github.com/apache/incubator-dubbo/blob/2.6.3-release/dubbo-rpc/dubbo-rpc-api/src/main/java/com/alibaba/dubbo/rpc/support/RpcUtils.java#L148)
中可以看到，2.6.x版本中也会受到 async 标记的影响的。

We only consider the method.async property now, if you are considering the async attribute, then you should consider 2.7.0-SNAPSHOT to think about the 2.6.x changes, even 2.5.x. 
The async is not from provider side.
And, I didn't even find the location to set the method.async.

> Suppose we update and restart the provider first. Since the consumer uses the old version, method.async does not affect the use of the Consumer

If we can make sure the above scenario, I prefer ignore method.async on the consumer side.

Other's opinion?
你看下你的jar包是不是少了，错误显示的是你这个RetryPolicy 这个类找不到。

Hi, @diecui1202 
After looking at the code, I think we really have to consider compatibility issues. 

After thinking, I think it would be better if you fix this problem at both ends.
1. On the Provider side, the method.async is not exposed to ensure compatibility.
2. Ignore the Provider's method.async property on the Consumer side to ensure that the Provider's method.async does not affect the Consumer's behavior.

In the future, when OPS shows the asynchronous situation of the provider, we just need to let the provider still register the method.async property.

What do u think?

> After looking at the code, I think we really have to consider compatibility issues.

@carryxyh Could u describe the scenario detailedly?

Hi, @diecui1202 
I checked the code. On 2.6.x, method.async is also passed to the Consumer side.
If you just ignore the method.async from the Provider side on the Consumer side (as my pr does), update and start the Provider first, then the method.async will still pass through to the Consumer and affect the Consumer's behavior.

Therefore, for compatibility reasons, it is necessary to fix the problem on the Provider side so that method.async is not registered to the registry.

In the Consumer, ignoring the Provider's method.async is equivalent to an insurance, ensuring that the Provider's method.async will not affect the Consumer's behavior under any circumstances.

* ServiceStore can replace ServiceStoreService as the entrance in RegistryConfig/ServiceConfig.
* Delete useless attributes in ServiceStoreConfig.
* Enrich method signature information, generalized inclusion and realize methods in PojoUtils may help.
* ServiceStore's HA strategy: if the server cannot be reached, ignore and try background. You can reference FailbackRegistry.
* ZK nodes written by ServiceStore should be changed to persistent
* OPS will need to retrieve the ServiceStore instance and I think you should provide the exact URL format used by ServiceStore.
* To decide which keys need to be registered to Registry, we can make it configurable by adding an item in dubbo.properties.
* Add a switch to control the URL registered to Registry: register the complete URL to the registry by default.
* Is it necessary to keep cache files locally in AbstractServiceStore? I think it's too complex, just log the error information in case of write failing can be enough.
